Key Match Events: Jarrett Allen scored 25 points, Evan Mobley added 21 points, and the Cleveland Cavaliers ended Oklahoma City’s 15-game winning streak by beating the Thunder 129-122.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 31 points and Jalen Williams had 25 for the Thunder in their first loss since Dec. 1.
The game had 30 lead changes and neither team led by more than nine points.
The matchup was only the third in history between teams riding double-digit winning streaks.
Isaiah Hartenstein finished with 18 points, 11 rebounds, and eight assists for the Thunder.
Mobley and Allen combined for 22 rebounds and 13 assists.
Darius Garland had 18 points, seven assists, and hit a floater to put OKC away.

With Cleveland up 125-122, Mitchell was called for a loose ball foul with 1:19 left. The Cavs challenged and the call was reversed by replay review. Mobley then hit a 10-footer in the lane to put Cleveland up by five.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Only four teams have posted a better record through 36 games than Cleveland: Golden State (34-2) in 2015-16, Philadelphia (33-3) in 1966-67, the Los Angeles Lakers (33-3) in 1971-72, and Chicago (33-3) in 1995-96.
